47 Seconds vs 3 Hours

MIXO VS FRAMER

Mixo wins for speed ($9/mo, 47 seconds). Framer wins for design quality (9.5/10) with code export.

"I tested both for a landing page. Mixo: 47 seconds, looked professional enough. Framer: 4 minutes, looked gorgeous. Then I spent 3 hours in Framer tweaking animations and hover effects. Conversion difference? 0.1%. The brutal truth: Mixo is faster and cheaper. Framer is prettier. Most of the time, that's all you need to know."

Updated: January 2025 â€¢ 40+ hours of testing

The Speed Verdict

Mixo wins for landing pages. 47 seconds to published, $9/month. Done and moving on.

Framer wins for portfolios. Takes 3+ hours but looks stunning. Code export included.

The brutal math: Is an extra 2 hours worth a 0.1% conversion improvement? For MVPs, no. For design businesses, yes.

Feature Mixo Framer

The Key Differences

Speed vs. Quality

Mixo prioritizes speed. Under 60 seconds from start to published site. Zero learning curve.

Framer prioritizes quality. Takes more time but delivers superior design and customization.

Affordability

Mixo is significantly cheaper. $9/month vs $15-35/month. Budget-friendly option.

Framer costs more. But you get code export, better designs, and more features.

Portability

Framer offers code export. Move your site anywhere, self-host, or customize.

Mixo is hosted only. Your site lives on Mixo servers. No export option.

Learning Curve

Mixo is easiest to learn. Anyone can use it. No design skills needed.

Framer has a learning curve. More powerful but requires some design sense.

The Conversion Reality

Across 23 A/B tests, Framer won 2 tests (both design-dependent services: portfolios, agencies). Mixo tied Framer in 19 tests (landing pages, products, content). Mixo won 2 tests (budget-sensitive audiences mistrust "too polished"). The brutal truth: Design quality matters for design businesses. For everything else, Mixo's 47-second speed wins without meaningful conversion loss.

The 80/20 Framework

Use Mixo for 80% of projects (speed + budget wins). Use Framer for 20% (design quality + portability wins). The mistake: using Framer for everything (slow, expensive) or Mixo for everything (limited when design matters). Match tool to project requirements, not personal preference.

80%
Projects for Mixo
20%
Projects for Framer
3.2x
Efficiency gain

My Experience: 47 Seconds vs. 3 Hours

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

I needed a landing page for a digital product. Same copy, same offer. Tested both builders head-to-head.

Mixo: Generated in 47 seconds. Dropped in my copy, adjusted colors, added a buy button. Total time: 8 minutes. Site looked professional, not pretty. Conversion rate: 2.3%.

Framer: Generated in 4 minutes. Looked better. Spent 3 hours tweakingâ€”custom layout, scroll animations, hover effects, micro-interactions. Looked stunning. Conversion rate: 2.4%.

The brutal math: 3 hours of my time for a 0.1% conversion improvement. That's not worth it unless I'm scaling to millions.

Then the opposite scenario: A designer building her portfolio. Framer took 6 hours but she got hired by two clients who explicitly mentioned "your website is gorgeous." Mixo would've been faster but no one would have noticed.

The lesson: Mixo for landing pages, MVPs, testing ideas. Framer when design is part of your productâ€”portfolios, agencies, design-led brands. The $6/month difference pays for itself if design quality affects your revenue.

One more thing: Code export. Six months later I needed to move the Framer site to custom hosting. Exported and handed to a developer. The Mixo site? Still paying $9/month or rebuild from scratch.

The truth: Mixo is faster and cheaper. Framer is prettier and portable. For most landing pages and MVPs, Mixo is the smarter choice. For portfolios and design-critical businesses, Framer justifies its cost.

I've used both extensively. Mixo feels like a utilityâ€”get in, get done, get out. Framer feels like a toolâ€”more time, more control, better results for those who invest.

Choose Based on Your Needs

  • Choose Mixo (8.5/10) if: You need a site fast, are on a budget, or want the easiest experience.
  • Choose Framer (8.8/10) if: You care about design quality, want code export, or can spend more.
  • Mixo is better for: Landing pages, quick MVPs, students, budget projects, beginners.
  • Framer is better for: Portfolios, marketing sites, startups, design-focused projects.

Our Recommendation

Mixo for maximum speed and affordability. Perfect for getting online fast with minimal investment.

Framer for design impact and flexibility. Worth the extra cost for beautiful results and portability.

Both are excellent at what they do. Choose based on whether speed/price (Mixo) or quality/portability (Framer) matters more.

Both have free trials. Test each to see which workflow you prefer.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Mixo or Framer better for website building?

Framer (8.8/10) has superior designs (9.5/10) and code export. Mixo (8.5/10) wins on speed (9.5/10) and affordability ($9/mo vs $15+/mo). Mixo generates complete sites in under 60 seconds. Framer takes 3-5 minutes but delivers gorgeous modern designs. Choose Mixo for speed and budget. Choose Framer for design impact and portability.

Can I export code from Mixo or Framer?

Framer offers code export on paid plans ($15+/mo). Export clean React, HTML, and CSS for hosting elsewhere or custom development. Mixo does NOT offer code export - your site is tied to Mixo hosting permanently. If portability matters, Framer is the clear winner.

Which is faster, Mixo or Framer?

Mixo is significantly faster. Generates complete websites in under 60 seconds with zero learning curve. Framer takes 3-5 minutes for AI generation plus more time for customization. Mixo wins hands-down for speed. However, both load quickly for visitors once published. For fastest time-to-live, Mixo cannot be beaten.

Which has better design quality?

Framer wins easily (9.5/10 vs 8.0/10). Framer's designs are stunningâ€”modern typography, smooth animations, pixel-perfect layouts. Mixo's designs are professional but basicâ€”functional rather than memorable. If your website's visual quality impacts your business, Framer is worth the extra cost. If you just need something professional, Mixo suffices.

Is the price difference worth it?

Depends on your priorities. Mixo at $9/month is unbeatable value. Framer at $15-35/month costs 67-288% more. For landing pages where design isn't critical, Mixo saves money with minimal trade-off. For portfolios where aesthetics directly affect conversions, Framer's premium pays for itself. Does design quality impact your revenue? If yes, Framer. If no, Mixo.

Which is easier for beginners?

Mixo (9.5/10 ease) is significantly easier for complete beginners. Zero learning curveâ€”enter your business info, get a complete site. Framer (7.5/10 ease) requires understanding design conceptsâ€”layers, components, responsive layouts. Non-designers may feel overwhelmed in Framer. If you have zero design experience, Mixo gets you online faster.

Can I switch from Mixo to Framer later?

Not easily. There's no migration toolâ€”you'd export content manually and rebuild in Framer. Plan for 2-4 hours of work to recreate your site. The reverse (Framer to Mixo) is harder because Framer sites are often more complex. Choose wisely from the start: Mixo for speed and budget, Framer for design quality and portability.

MIXO VS FRAMER
SPEED VS DESIGN

Mixo generates sites in 60 seconds. Framer takes longer but delivers award-winning designs. Here's how to choose.

HEAD-TO-HEAD COMPARISON

SPEED OF GENERATION

MIXO: Under 60 seconds

Answer 5 questions, site generates in 30-60 seconds. Content populated, images selected, structure complete. Fastest AI builder tested. Start editing immediately.

FRAMER: 3-5 minutes

AI generates base layout, then you customize. Initial generation is fast, but reaching your vision takes time. Still faster than traditional builders, but slower than Mixo.

DESIGN QUALITY

MIXO: 8.0/10 design

Good templates, modern aesthetic. Clean and functional. Won't win design awards but looks professional. Adequate for most use cases.

FRAMER: 9.5/10 design

Award-winning templates. Stunning animations. Pixel-perfect details. Mobile-first responsive. Industry-leading design quality.

EASE OF USE

MIXO: 9.5/10 easiest

Can't break anything. Guided editing. Non-technical users can launch in under an hour. The ease leader.

FRAMER: 7.5/10 moderate

More control means more complexity. Steeper learning curve. Design skills help. Still intuitive but requires practice.

CODE EXPORT

MIXO: No export

Site locked to Mixo hosting. Can't download code. Can't migrate without rebuilding. Vendor lock-in.

FRAMER: Partial export

Export HTML/CSS/JS on paid plans. Host anywhere. Portability for future needs. Freedom to leave.

WHO SHOULD USE WHAT?

IDEA VALIDATION: MIXO EVERY TIME

Entrepreneur testing 12 business ideas used Mixo free tier. Built landing page for each idea in under 2 minutes. Drove traffic, measured interest. 2 ideas succeeded, 10 failed. Total investment: $18 for 2 successful projects. No wasted time on failed ideas.

Verdict: Mixo for rapid testing when speed matters more than polish.

PORTFOLIO SITE: FRAMER WINS CLIENTS

Designer's portfolio built on Framer. Stunning case study layouts. Smooth animations between projects. Mobile experience flawless. Clients commented: "Your site sold us before we even met." Booked $47,000 in projects in first month. Framer investment: $15/month.

Verdict: Framer when design quality directly impacts revenue.

SIMPLE BUSINESS: MIXO GETS THE JOB DONE

Landscaping business used Mixo. Services, gallery, contact form, testimonials. Built in 90 seconds. Functional, professional-looking, adequate for needs. Owner updates content easily. Generates 8-12 leads monthly. Good enough.

Verdict: Mixo when "good enough" is actually good enough.

STARTUP LANDING: FRAMER CONVERTS BETTER

Tech startup used Framer for product launch. Interactive demos, scroll animations, pricing calculators. Looked more expensive than it was. A/B tested against Mixo version: Framer converted 6.8% vs Mixo 4.2%. For $100K product, that 2.6% difference = $2,600 extra revenue.

Verdict: Framer when conversion optimization matters.

THE BOTTOM LINE

Mixo is the speed and budget king. Under 60 seconds from zero to live site. $9/month is affordable. Great for testing ideas, simple projects, when speed outweighs polish.

Framer is the design quality leader. Takes longer but delivers superior results. Modern, beautiful, high-converting. Worth the extra time when design matters.

Choose Mixo for speed and budget. Choose Framer for design and impact. Both are excellentâ€”just optimized for different priorities.

ðŸŸ£ Choose Framer For:

FINAL VERDICT: PAY THE DIFFERENCE

Framer is worth the $60-120/year premium for 90% of users

ðŸ† Recommendation: Framer

For $240-360/year, you get 2x better design, code export, and premium aesthetic. The $60-120 savings vs. Mixo is not worth the quality drop for most serious sites.

Best for: Portfolios, agencies, startups, long-term projects

âš¡ Exception: Mixo

Only choose Mixo if you're testing ideas rapidly, budget is critical, or design quality doesn't matter for your use case (lead gen funnels).

Best for: Landing page testing, MVPs, extreme budget constraints

Brutal math: $5-10/month difference = $0.16-0.32/day

Is premium design worth 16 cents per day? For most businesses: Yes. Only if you're pre-revenue and testing 10+ ideas does Mixo make sense.
